item.title: Writing a GitHub Webhook as an Azure Function
item.description: I recently experimented with Azure Functions and GitHub apps, and I wanted to share what I learned. A bit of background As you may already know, I’m one of the maintainers of the FakeItEasy mocking library. As is common in open-source projects, we use a workflow based on feature branches and pull requests. When a change is requested in a PR during code review, we usually make the change as a fixup commit, because it makes it easier to review, and because we like to keep a clean history.
